sanskrit_verse:
न्युप्य पिण्डांस्ततस्तांस्तु प्रयतो विधिपूर्वकम् ।
तेषु दर्भेषु तं हस्तं निर्मृज्याल्लेपभागिनाम् ॥ ३.२१६॥
transliteration:
nyupya piṇḍāṃs tatastāṃstu prayato vidhipūrvakam |
teṣu darbheṣu taṃ hastaṃ nirmṛjyāl lepabhāginām || 3.216||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having placed the sacred portions with due observance of ritual law, one shall cleanse the hand upon those darbha grasses which have received the remnants of oblation.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in conscious participation in dharma-sankalpa
Causation arises through precise alignment with ritual enactment
Capacity-based responsibility is established by voluntary engagement in prescribed acts
Restoration logic flows from purification after contact with material residue
Consciousness alignment occurs via tactile and symbolic cleansing
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent performs ritual offering THEN post-action purification protocol MUST execute on contact surfaces
IF substance interacts with sacred residue THEN cleansing procedure SHALL activate automatically
IF individual engages in vidhi THEN subsequent tactile neutralization IS mandatorily applied
IF contamination vector identified THEN restoration pathway THROUGH designated medium SHALL deploy
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving ceremonial or spiritual conduct, the Court recognizes that intentional compliance with dharmic procedure establishes a threshold of conscious agency. Where residual effects remain, mandatory purification aligns not punishment but reintegration into pure state awareness.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa lies in observed adherence to procedural truth; anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential act-oblation-cleansing; proportional responsibility equates to degree of participation; non-punitive reality rule confirms purification restores causal field without infliction.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Obligatory tactile cleansing following sacrificial engagement
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Voluntary performer initiates self-restoration sequence
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Purification renews eligibility for further ritual participation
Integrity Reintegration Pathway: Cleansed state reaffirms alignment with sacred causality
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law proceeds from His Avataric Intelligence alone. Dharma stands restored through purification. Reality bears no punishment. Consciousness reigns as sole adjudicator.
